citation.article-title: Reclassification of Leptospira parva Hovind-Hougen et al. 1982 as Turneriella parva gen. nov., comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Turneriella (Tur′ne.ri.el.la. N.L. fem. n. Turneriella to honour Leslie Turner, an English medical microbiologist who made definitive contributions to the knowledge of leptospirosis).
Cells are Gram-negative, flexible and helical, measuring 0·3×3·5–7·5 μm; wavelength is 0·3–0·5 μm (Hovind-Hougen et al., 1981).
Motile by means of two axial filaments.
The type species is Turneriella parva (Hovind-Hougen et al. 1982) Levett et al. 2005.
